We had finished moving in all their stuff and\nfinally had a chance to settle down.%K%P
And conveniently it was right about lunchtime.\nKaede offered to treat us to some of her home\ncooking, but...%K%P
\dWhat...? The fridge is completely empty.\d%K%P
\dOh yeah, you don't cook at all, do you Aki?\nMicrowave dinners for life! Just like me!\d%K%P
\dDon't go lumping me in with you like that.\d%K%P
\dYou're gonna deny it? With a fridge that's\nbasically just a condiment shelf?\d%K%P
It wasn't just condiments. I had drinks and stuff\ntoo!%K%P
\dSorry, it's all my own fault for failing in my\nwifely duties... My oh my...\d%K%P
\dBut you only got here yesterday, right?\d%K%P
\dI did, yes. But after I served up the most\nspectacular of dinners we were just fresh out of\neverything.\d%K%P
\dSo that's what happened...\d%K%P
\dI have shamed my poor husband! Please punish me,\nmy sweetheart! Please! Please!\d%K%P
You could sense the excitement in her voice as she\nlooked my way.%K%P
\dYou're into that sort of thing, then?\d%K%P
\dWhy yes! I figure it's all part of the\nexperience!\d%K%P
\dPlease, spank this bottom of mine to punish me...\d%K%P
\dNah, I don't really blame you for this.\d%K%P
\dWell, do it as a reward! I'm ready!\d%K%P
\dGimme a break already, that's pushing it.\d%K%P
Even Shion had had enough of Yukari's hijinks.%K%P
\dIn that case, allow me. Best clench those teeth,\nmy dear.\d%K%P
\dWhat?! No one asked you! I want to be thrashed by\nAkira's love for me!\d%K%P
\dAs his better half I am the one who takes over all\nthe dirty work.\d%K%P
\dPffft, dirty is right.\d%K%P
\dMy behind is not dirty! It's clean and pristine!\d%K%P
\dYes, yes. Now brace yourself. Here it comes!\d%K%P
\dNo stop! Akira, help me!\d%K%P
Fleeing from Kaede, Yukari latched on to me from\nbehind.%K%P
\dOh yes, this is where I am meant to be... I just\ncan't keep going when I am not right at your\nside...\d%K%P
\dYou can cling on all you want, but Kaede's still\ngot that death stare for you.\d%K%P
\dHey! Don't you run from me! Get back here!\d%K%P
\dWah! You're scary! Surely a gentle girl like me\nwould make a better life partner for Akira.\d%K%P
\dAnd just what about you is gentle?\d%K%P
\dYou're both pretty scary, to be honest.\d%K%P
\dWhich means that through the process of\nelimination I'm the best choice, right?\d%K%P
\dWives and spouses can be such a pain, but a\nmistress offers all the fun with no future\ntrouble.\d%K%P
\dYou're really good at squeezing yourself in like\nthat, huh Shion?\d%K%P
\dA girl's gotta know how to get by.\d%K%P
And with that she came right up to me.%K%P
Just close enough to be comfortable but not\nbothersome. It was just like her.%K%P
Since there was nothing to cook with, we decided to\ngo out grocery shopping.%K%P
\dApologies for the wait Akira, I'm ready to go\nnow.\d%K%P
\dAki! How do I look not all dressed up? Cute? Too\nadorable to handle?\d%K%P
\dYou both look great. I've only ever seen you in\nyour Goddess garb, so this is kind of refreshing.\d%K%P
\dIs it really? I think it looks pretty drab.\d%K%P
\dWell what about you? If we're heading out you\nshould change.\d%K%P
\dHmph! Well I'm proud of my attire. And Akira here\ntold me he loves the way I look in it.\d%K%P
\dYeah, it looks good on you, but I think you should\nget changed, too.\d%K%P
The other two were dressed down, so it felt weird\nhaving Yukari still done up all Goddess-like.%K%P
\dIf you won't you'll have to stay home alone. So\nwhat will it be?\d%K%P
\dI'll change! I'll change! Oh Akira, you should\nhave just told me you wanted to see your beautiful\nwife in a different outfit!\d%K%P
\dGlad you changed your mind and all, but do you\neven have any other clothes?\d%K%P
\dOh...\d%K%P
Yukari had showed up at the shrine with basically\nnothing to her name. Of course she didn't have a\nchange of clothes.%K%P
\dToo bad for you!\d%K%P
\dWell Akira has clothes, I'll just borrow his!\d%K%P
\dHehehe, soon Akira and I will be one in a whole\nnew way... It will be like he's always hugging\nme...\d%K%P
\dUhhh, sorry to interrupt, but I don't think that's\ngonna fly...\d%K%P
\dFine, I'll buy them from you! How much?\d%K%P
\dThat's not the issue here.\d%K%P
\dYou can borrow some of my clothes if you want.\d%K%P
\d...Pffft.\d%K%P
\dWha-- You! You just laughed, didn't you? Making\nfun of me for being too small, huh? Gah!\d%K%P
\dLet's just calm down, Shion. You're fine.\d%K%P
\dTeeheehee.\d%K%P
A quick pat on the head and she calmed down again.%K%P
\dWhat do you two think you're doing? Is that\npetting I see?! That right should be reserved for\nme!\d%K%P
\dOkay, I'll let Yukari borrow my clothes. Better\nthat then let Shion have Akira to herself.\d%K%P
\dSorry for the trouble. I'm sure we're just about\nthe same size, anyway.\d%K%P
\dBut before that... Hehehe!\d%K%P
Yukari's mood was quickly turning black.%K%P
\dDon't go getting in the way, you hear?\d%K%P
\dFine, fine. Just make it quick.\d%K%P
\dHow dare you go and fawn on Akira like that!\d%K%P
\dUh oh! Am I in for another bucket?!\d%K%P
Shion's eyes darted upwards.%K%P
But nothing seemed amiss up above.%K%P
\dHah, did you mess this one up? Ahaha!\d%K%P
\dGaaah! I bit my tongue!\d%K%P
Just when she thought the Tatari had missed, it\ncame back to bite her in the...tongue.%K%P
It could have just been coincidence, but it felt\ntoo perfectly timed for that.%K%P
\dWait, was that the Tatari?\d%K%P
It was a pretty trivial happening, but it was so on\npoint, too.%K%P
Intrigued, I turned my gaze Yukari's way and...%K%P
\dShe should have bit it right off. If only she'd\nbitten it right off... Bite it off, bite it off,\nbite it off, off off off...\d%K%P
Was she trying to conjure up a curse?!%K%P
She was definitely mumbling troubling things over\nand over again.%K%P
Seeing her like that was a solid reminder that she\nwas indeed a Tatarigami.%K%P
\dWell, I'm sure we can tolerate at least this\nmuch.\d%K%P
\dWhy am I always the one on the receiving end?\d%K%P
\dHehehe!\d%K%P
So Yukari borrowed some clothes from Kaede and\nwe all finally headed out to go shopping.%K%P
\dI couldn't stand the idea of wearing that woman's\nclothing, but now that I'm out of my normal attire,\nI feel like we look like a normal couple, Akira!\d%K%P
\dNow we seem much more like husband and wife\nthan man and Goddess locked in a forbidden\nlove...\d%K%P
\dOh, how wonderful this is... I'm so excited I can\nhardly contain myself!\d%K%P
\dBy all means, don't exert yourself. Why not stay\nback at the shrine?\d%K%P
\dYeah, you can just leave Aki here to the two of\nus.\d%K%P
\dAbsolutely not!\d%K%P
\dJeez, I really have to stay on my toes around you\ntwo. Guess I'll have to remain right by Akira's\nside.\d%K%P
She snuck right up to me and slid her arm through\nmine for all to see.%K%P
\dHey! That's not fair!\d%K%P
\dHehehe! Now then, let's get going, shall we?\d%K%P
The place I always went shopping was a 30-minute\nwalk from the shrine.%K%P
We were certainly taking our time, but it wasn't\nall that bad.%K%P
\dHere we are. This is the little place I always\nshop at.\d%K%P
\dCan you really call this store...?\d%K%P
Yukari was a little puzzled at my choice of words.%K%P
\dIt's more like a stand, I guess.\d%K%P
\dFor us it's the closest 'shop' around.\d%K%P
\dIs it like some rest stop for tourists?\d%K%P
\dHey, you can get pretty much everything here.\nFresh vegetables, meat, even fish.\d%K%P
They even had most daily necessities.%K%P
It was more convenient than most convenience\nstores.%K%P
\dMaybe you didn't know, Yukari, but places out in\nthe countryside are pretty much all like this.\d%K%P
These little stands started out selling local\nproduce along with more touristy goods.%K%P
They grew from there to almost become little\nmarkets in their own right.%K%P
\dIf you head down into Kamimori City where the\nmain shrine is there are much bigger stores.\d%K%P
\dBut this place is the best for picking up\nsupplies.\d%K%P
\dOh, Shion! I couldn't have said it better myself.\d%K%P
\dHey Mr. Marunuma. Got anything good in today?\nAny recommendations?\d%K%P
\dYou betcha. We got some nice persimmons in just\ntoday. Here, have a try.\d%K%P
\dYay! Thanks!\d%K%P
Mr. Marunuma cut up some persimmon.%K%P
And not just for Shion, but for all of us.%K%P
\dWow... It's so sweet.\d%K%P
\dAnd look how big it is. You're really something,\nMr. Marunuma.\d%K%P
\dWell ain't those just the kindest words, Lady\nKaede.\d%K%P
He was lax around Shion, but in front of Kaede he'd\nput on his best manners.%K%P
\dWhy's he acting like that...?\d%K%P
\dWell, she's a special Goddess to the people of\nKamimori.\d%K%P
She'd been here ever since she was a Tatarigami.%K%P
Everyone had known her through the good times and\nthe bad.%K%P
\dWhat about Shion?\d%K%P
\dShion hasn't been here as long. People know she's\na Goddess, but that's about it.\d%K%P
The residents of Kamimori were well aware that\nKaede had been a Tatarigami.%K%P
But none of them knew what kind of Goddess Shion\nwas.%K%P
\dOkay, let's get a bowl of those big persimmons\nand... Some vegetables, some meat, and then and\nthen...!\d%K%P
\dI'll handle selecting what we need, thank you. You\ncan negotiate the price.\d%K%P
\dRoger-dodger! Hey mister, we're gonna buy lots, so\nmake sure you cut us a deal, yeah?\d%K%P
Shion got along best with the people here, showing\noff a side of herself I rarely saw anywhere else.%K%P
Thanks to her haggling skills we got lots of\ngroceries for a great price.%K%P
\dBy the way, Akira, is Kenji ever coming back?\d%K%P
\dNot for a while it seems. He said he'd be back for\nNew Year's, though.\d%K%P
\dThat so? Huh... Well, shoot.\d%K%P
\dSomething wrong?\d%K%P
\dIt's almost time for the fall festival, yeah? Was\njust thinking how Kamimori will be missing out this\nyear.\d%K%P
The annual festival wasn't only held at the main\nshrine, but also out here at the other branches,\ntoo.%K%P
It was nowhere near the same size, but for the\nlocal people it was an important celebration of the\nharvest.%K%P
\dSorry, but I just don't think I could do it\nwithout my parents around...\d%K%P
\dNah, I getcha. We'll just have to make do with the\nShiraito Red Leaf Festival, I 'spose.\d%K%P
\dReal shame though. It's fine for us old folk, but\nit'd be a good chance to match up for some of the\nyoung'uns.\d%K%P
\dUhm, what is that supposed to mean?\d%K%P
\dHow now? Don't cha know?\d%K%P
\dAny couple that profess their love at Kamimori\nShrine's fall festival are said to live happily\never after.\d%K%P
\dThese are the Shiraito Falls, Kamimori's most\npopular tourist spot.\d%K%P
Since we'd come all this way, we decided to visit\nthe falls. They were only five minutes away.%K%P
This time of the year lots of tourists came out to\nenjoy the red leaves.%K%P
\dSo, you back on earth with us yet, space cadet?\d%K%P
\dSorry Akira. I've just had something on my mind.\d%K%P
\dIt just feels so unfair to call off the\nfestivities the people have been waiting for...\d%K%P
She seemed genuinely sad for them.%K%P
\dYeah, I know how you feel.\d%K%P
It wouldn't be impossible for me to hold the\nfestival myself, but I was still in training.%K%P
Pulling it off all alone would put a little too\nmuch weight on my shoulders.%K%P
\dAnd listening to what Mr. Marunuma said...\d%K%P
\dHe really loves his festivals.\d%K%P
\dI too enjoy the smiling faces of our visitors...\d%K%P
\dCan't you do something, Akira?\d%K%P
\dI mean, you really should! Let's do it! We can't\njust call off the big yearly festival!\d%K%P
\dIt's a place for the youth to meet! For them to\nfall in love for ever and ever!\d%K%P
\dOh yes, we could both protect the tradition by\nprofessing our love to one another, and let\neveryone know we are a married couple...\d%K%P
\dSo that's what this was all about, huh?\d%K%P
\dYes! Of course! Of course it is! What's wrong with\nthat? A woman in love cannot sit and wait!\d%K%P
The whole way home I thought about nothing but\nthe festival.%K%P
I could just picture the disappointed looks on our\nvisitors' faces.%K%P
\dHey, so... If I were to say I wanted to do the\nwhole fall festival thing...\d%K%P
\d...Would you all help me out?\d%K%P
\dOf course. As your wife I would help you with\nanything you ask.\d%K%P
\dI would also aid you. I try not to assume too much\nauthority, but I do feel I must act in place of\nyour parents.\d%K%P
\dI'll help too! Gotta make up for all the trouble I\nnormally cause for everyone.\d%K%P
\dYou've been causing trouble, then...?\d%K%P
\dNot on purpose. But I am a Goddess of Misfortune,\nafter all.\d%K%P
\dM-Misfortune?!\d%K%P
Yukari immediately drew away from her at that\nrevelation.%K%P
\dOh, didn't I tell you? Yup, I basically just rain\nbad luck down all around me.\d%K%P
\dThat certainly explains the unfortunate way you\nlook...\d%K%P
\dWhat's that supposed to mean? My figure has\nnothing to do with my powers!\d%K%P
\dWow, so you're not only a Goddess of Misfortune,\nbut also quite misfortunate yourself.\d%K%P
\dNgh... Okay, jeez. I get it...\d%K%P
She might not have had the volume the other two\ndid, but she wasn't that bad.%K%P
\dBut yes, I am a Goddess of Misfortune, so those\nwho come in contact with me slowly succumb to it\nover time.\d%K%P
Her divine powers weren't all that different from\nthose of a Tatarigami.%K%P
She couldn't control it of her own will, it just\nhappened around her.%K%P
And she hated that, so she had ran away and wound\nup here.%K%P
\dIt's only fair that I do something to make up for\nthat in some way.\d%K%P
\dSo if you're down Aki, I'm down too. I got your\nback.\d%K%P
\dSame here. How about you, Yukari?\d%K%P
\dI want only what Akira desires.\d%K%P
\dThat's not really what I'm asking. Try again.\d%K%P
\dI...\d%K%P
\dI want to do this festival, too. And I want to\nlive happily forever with Akira.\d%K%P
Everyone expected that answer, but no one called\nher out on it.%K%P
Reasons aside, she seemed determined.%K%P
\dThat's not such a bad idea really. Maybe I'll give\nprofessing my love in front of everyone a shot,\ntoo.\d%K%P
\dWell then, I suppose I will too.\d%K%P
\dOh, I see. So you're asking for a challenge? Fine.\nPrepare to lose!\d%K%P
And like always, the three of them were working to\noutdo each other.%K%P
But their competition would certainly translate\ninto an exciting festival.%K%P
\dThat settles it, then.\d%K%P
\dLet's have us a festival. I'm counting on you\nthree.\d%K%P
\dOkay!\d%K%P
